How To Run Aion Wallet Offline and Locally



For increased security, you can run Aion Wallet on your computer instead of from the GitHub servers. The computer should have no internet connection. You can generate a wallet completely offline and send transactions from the "Send Offline" page.


Downloading and installing

In order to setup your local Aion Wallet, start off by downloading the latest release of Aion Wallet here. Click on Aionwallet-vX.X.X.X.zip, to download the file. Move this file to a USB stick or something similar, in order to move it to your offline computer.

Plug the USB stick into your offline computer and extract all files in the archive to the computer. You should now have a folder containing these files:

Running Aion Wallet

To open Aion Wallet, double click the index.html file. This should open your browser. You will get a warning saying that it is unable to connect to the network, but this is completely normal. You won't be able to see your Aion or token balance through your local Aion Wallet, but you can still use Aionerscan or Aionplorer to see your balance.

We recommend you periodically update your local version of Aion Wallet, as we are constantly updating the website.
